the **wheat stitch™ keychain & lanyard** pattern is the perfect way to bring cozy crochet texture into your everyday life! using my *[signature wheat stitch™][1]*, this quick and satisfying project adds handmade charm to your keys, bags, or badge lanyard — and it makes a beautiful, practical gift.

worked flat in rows, these accessories are designed with the same stitch texture loved in the wheat stitch scarf and other matching projects. you’ll start with a simple foundation and build up that signature wheat-inspired texture one row at a time. whether you’re new to the stitch or already hooked, this is a relaxing make that’s easy to finish in an afternoon!

[a video tutorial is included in the pattern.][2]

**crochet hook:** 
[g (4.0mm) - or size to meet gauge][3]

**notions:**
[removable stitch markers][4] 
[yarn needle to weave in ends][5] 
[scissors][6]
[swivel clasp][7]

**yarn:**
[village yarn craft cotton yarn][8]
100% cotton, 115yds/71g

**yarn quantities:**
small (large) wristlet
15 (20) yds
short (long) lanyard
25 (35) yds

**yarn substitutions:**
[premier home cotton][9] - 85% cotton, 15% polyester; 131yds/75g

[lily sugar 'n cream][10] - 100% cotton; 120yds/71g

[wecrochet dishie][11] - 100% cotton; 190yds/100g

[herrschners cottage cotton][12] - 60% cotton, 40% acrylic blend; 207yds/100g

**abbreviations:**
blo- back loop only
ch - chain
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
ws - wrong side

**gauge:**
not critical for this design.
17 sts and 12 rows = 4” in stitch pattern

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post:  [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][13]

**sizes:**
s/l wristlet or s/l lanyard

**skill level:**
advanced beginner
